Often-times people must take their time and search for different service providers for different services they need or simply want in order to attain their desires, our goal is to free up that search time by being a one stop solution service provider.

In business since 1974, Argo Building Company is a provider of construction services. Located in Birmingham, Ala., the company offers services in project budgeting, designing, building, preconstruction and construction management, including planning, coordinating and monitoring. Argo Building Company has executed number of projects in various facilities, including, restaurant and bar, hospital, commercial, public works, educational and churches. Its completed projects include Alabama Central Credit Union Corporate Headquarters and Hoover Police Center. The company is among the top 25 Alabama's Top Contractors in South central construction.

Cary Insulation Company offers a range of insulation services for residential and commercial properties. The company has been in operation since 1948. It specializes in blown insulation services. The company offers installation services for fiberglass, floor, ceiling and wall batts. It also provides blown attic and fire-blocking insulation services. In addition, the company offers installation services for air infiltration foams and baffles. Cary Insulation Company provides products from CertainTeed Corporation. Our technicians are highly qualified and knowledgeable about insulation for various properties. Bhate Associates, headquartered in Birmingham, Ala., is a consulting firm specializing in engineering, science and construction services. Established in 1989, the firm has worked in more than six countries and throughout the United States, offering investigative, compliance, design and remediation, construction and information technology services. Bhate s clients include the U.S. Army, Air Force and Navy, National Aeronautics and Space Administration, and the U.S. Postal Service. It has also provided services to industrial manufacturing companies, utility and development companies, and state and local government agencies. The company s staff consists of experienced engineers, geologists, scientists, technicians, information and technology, and construction personnel. Bhate Associates  construction services include cost estimating, design and specifications, construction management, engineering services, construction and operating permits, and historic building renovations.

Founded in 1930, Rives Construction Company, Inc. is one of the leading names in the construction industry in the Southeast. The company offers a wide array of services, including general contracting, design-build and construction management. Located in Birmingham, Ala., Rives Construction Company, Inc. undertakes commercial, corporate aviation, automotive, health care, churches, institutional, industrial, financial and interior renovations and buildout projects. It caters to the needs of subcontractors, suppliers and communities. The Alabama Amateur Softball Association has awarded the 2010 General Contractor of the Year award to this company.

H.N. Donahoo has complete projects for Winn-Dixie at Helena, Greystone Park, John Carroll High School, Kensington Place and Charleston Square. The company specializes in land grading and site development contracting. H.N. Donahoo started doing business in Alabama in the early 1920s and specialized in paving, sewer, water and gas pipelines. Over the years, the company has become a one-stop source for residential and commercial site development needs. The company has the capability to perform initial clearing and grading for streets, building pads, parking lots, mass excavation of dirt and rock and erosion control; installation of underground utilities, such as storm and sanitary pipes, water mains, gas lines and electrical and telephone conduits; concrete gutter construction, which includes curbs and gutters, concrete islands, sidewalks and driveways; and asphalt paving. H.N. Donahoo Contracting serves residential and commercial customers in the Birmingham, Ala., area.

Founded in 1980, PRO Construction provides restoration services for hospitals, schools, stores, restaurants, factories, libraries, laboratories, barns, private homes and garages. The company remodels commercial and private residences for architects, as well as individuals. PRO Construction offers tenant improvement, new construction, and design and build commercial services. The company restores and repairs damaged goods and contents, including books, clothing, files, documents, photographs, mementos, draperies, computers, and electronic devices and components. It also provides reconstruction and replacement services. PRO Construction offers a range of preconstruction and construction services using a systematic approach to budget development and project delivery. The company also provides stump grinding, fencing, door fitting, and pool installation and design services. It offers basement and bathroom remodeling, cabinetry installation, floor refinishing, and landscape architectural and contracting services.

Hoar Construction is a full service contractor with retail, commercial, program management and health care divisions. The company services include negotiated, bid, design-build, construction management, program management, pre-construction services and general construction. Hoar Construction was established in 1940 in Birmingham, Ala. The company originally specialized in community church construction and erected more than 45 church buildings during the formative years. The developing company continued to build a reputation for quality workmanship and experienced management. It expanded to commercial and industrial clients, and building office buildings, schools and retail shopping centers. Hoar Construction operates throughout much of the United States. Its average volume is more than $350 million per year.
Let Us Put Your House Back Into Shape

Cooper Construction Company is a general contracting business that specializes in commercial warehousing and distribution services. It offers solutions for industrial and retail centers. Founded in 1991, the company maintains a more than 500,000-square-foot warehouse in Vance in Alabama. Cooper Construction Company operates in Alabama, Florida, Georgia, North Carolina, Tennessee, Kentucky and Mississippi. It also provides tenant improvement services. The company has undertaken projects for Jim Burke Nissan, Serra Chrysler, Chatham Steel and Cascades Sonoco. In addition, Cooper Construction Company offers internship programs. It has received the Rainbird Award for Excellence. The company also works with owners and tenants.

Dunn Construction Company began as a railroad construction company in Virginia before moving to Birmingham. Today, the company serves construction needs in road building, general construction, asphalt, ready mix concrete and related products. Dunn Construction has recently expanded its Quality Control/Quality Assurance Division. The personnel from this division undergo training and testing, both in-house and through Alabama Asphalt Pavement Association courses, to become certified by the Alabama Department of Transportation in various aspects of the design and testing of bituminous concrete. Along with principal offices in Birmingham, Ala., and Jackson, Miss., the company has subsidiaries throughout Alabama. Dunn Construction was founded in 1878.

Founded in 1930, Rives Construction Company, Inc. is one of the leading names in the construction industry in the Southeast. The company offers a wide array of services, including general contracting, design-build and construction management. Located in Birmingham, Ala., Rives Construction Company, Inc. undertakes commercial, corporate aviation, automotive, health care, churches, institutional, industrial, financial and interior renovations and buildout projects. It caters to the needs of subcontractors, suppliers and communities. The Alabama Amateur Softball Association has awarded the 2010 General Contractor of the Year award to this company.

H.N. Donahoo has complete projects for Winn-Dixie at Helena, Greystone Park, John Carroll High School, Kensington Place and Charleston Square. The company specializes in land grading and site development contracting. H.N. Donahoo started doing business in Alabama in the early 1920s and specialized in paving, sewer, water and gas pipelines. Over the years, the company has become a one-stop source for residential and commercial site development needs. The company has the capability to perform initial clearing and grading for streets, building pads, parking lots, mass excavation of dirt and rock and erosion control; installation of underground utilities, such as storm and sanitary pipes, water mains, gas lines and electrical and telephone conduits; concrete gutter construction, which includes curbs and gutters, concrete islands, sidewalks and driveways; and asphalt paving. H.N. Donahoo Contracting serves residential and commercial customers in the Birmingham, Ala., area.

Founded in 1980, PRO Construction provides restoration services for hospitals, schools, stores, restaurants, factories, libraries, laboratories, barns, private homes and garages. The company remodels commercial and private residences for architects, as well as individuals. PRO Construction offers tenant improvement, new construction, and design and build commercial services. The company restores and repairs damaged goods and contents, including books, clothing, files, documents, photographs, mementos, draperies, computers, and electronic devices and components. It also provides reconstruction and replacement services. PRO Construction offers a range of preconstruction and construction services using a systematic approach to budget development and project delivery. The company also provides stump grinding, fencing, door fitting, and pool installation and design services. It offers basement and bathroom remodeling, cabinetry installation, floor refinishing, and landscape architectural and contracting services.

Hoar Construction is a full service contractor with retail, commercial, program management and health care divisions. The company services include negotiated, bid, design-build, construction management, program management, pre-construction services and general construction. Hoar Construction was established in 1940 in Birmingham, Ala. The company originally specialized in community church construction and erected more than 45 church buildings during the formative years. The developing company continued to build a reputation for quality workmanship and experienced management. It expanded to commercial and industrial clients, and building office buildings, schools and retail shopping centers. Hoar Construction operates throughout much of the United States. Its average volume is more than $350 million per year.

Cooper Construction Company is a general contracting business that specializes in commercial warehousing and distribution services. It offers solutions for industrial and retail centers. Founded in 1991, the company maintains a more than 500,000-square-foot warehouse in Vance in Alabama. Cooper Construction Company operates in Alabama, Florida, Georgia, North Carolina, Tennessee, Kentucky and Mississippi. It also provides tenant improvement services. The company has undertaken projects for Jim Burke Nissan, Serra Chrysler, Chatham Steel and Cascades Sonoco. In addition, Cooper Construction Company offers internship programs. It has received the Rainbird Award for Excellence. The company also works with owners and tenants.

Dunn Construction Company began as a railroad construction company in Virginia before moving to Birmingham. Today, the company serves construction needs in road building, general construction, asphalt, ready mix concrete and related products. Dunn Construction has recently expanded its Quality Control/Quality Assurance Division. The personnel from this division undergo training and testing, both in-house and through Alabama Asphalt Pavement Association courses, to become certified by the Alabama Department of Transportation in various aspects of the design and testing of bituminous concrete. Along with principal offices in Birmingham, Ala., and Jackson, Miss., the company has subsidiaries throughout Alabama. Dunn Construction was founded in 1878.

Operational since 1971, BSE Industrial Contractors offers a range of services for clients in the construction industry. It provides plant maintenance and rebuilding services. The company also installs silo storage, unloading, packing and palletizing systems, as well as kilns, air slides, tires, and coolers. BSE Industrial Contractors replaces buckets, chains, rails and liners in pan conveyors. With a fleet of more than 50 cranes, the company sets concrete poles, structural towers and transformers. In addition, it assists with the construction of heat recovery systems in furnaces. BSE Industrial Contractors undertakes several specialty contracting, commercial and heavy industrial projects. Its clients include United States Steel, International Paper Company, Lehigh Cement Company and Alabama Power.

It offers employee identification imaging systems and electromechanical and electronic time recorders. The company serves the educational, health care and manufacturing industries.

The company has the capability to perform initial clearing and grading for streets, building pads, parking lots, mass excavation of dirt and rock and erosion control; installation of underground utilities, such as storm and sanitary pipes, water mains, gas lines and electrical and telephone conduits; concrete gutter construction, which includes curbs and gutters, concrete islands, sidewalks and driveways; and asphalt paving. Founded in 1930, Rives Construction Company, Inc. is one of the leading names in the construction industry in the Southeast. The company offers a wide array of services, including general contracting, design-build and construction management. H.N. Donahoo has complete projects for Winn-Dixie at Helena, Greystone Park, John Carroll High School, Kensington Place and Charleston Square. The company specializes in land grading and site development contracting. H.N. Donahoo started doing business in Alabama in the early 1920s and specialized in paving, sewer, water and gas pipelines. Over the years, the company has become a one-stop source for residential and commercial site development needs. The company has the capability to perform initial clearing and grading for streets, building pads, parking lots, mass excavation of dirt and rock and erosion control; installation of underground utilities, such as storm and sanitary pipes, water mains, gas lines and electrical and telephone conduits; concrete gutter construction, which includes curbs and gutters, concrete islands, sidewalks and driveways; and asphalt paving. H.N. Donahoo Contracting serves residential and commercial customers in the Birmingham, Ala., area.

Founded in 1980, PRO Construction provides restoration services for hospitals, schools, stores, restaurants, factories, libraries, laboratories, barns, private homes and garages. The company remodels commercial and private residences for architects, as well as individuals. PRO Construction offers tenant improvement, new construction, and design and build commercial services. The company restores and repairs damaged goods and contents, including books, clothing, files, documents, photographs, mementos, draperies, computers, and electronic devices and components. It also provides reconstruction and replacement services. PRO Construction offers a range of preconstruction and construction services using a systematic approach to budget development and project delivery. The company also provides stump grinding, fencing, door fitting, and pool installation and design services. It offers basement and bathroom remodeling, cabinetry installation, floor refinishing, and landscape architectural and contracting services.

Hoar Construction is a full service contractor with retail, commercial, program management and health care divisions. The company services include negotiated, bid, design-build, construction management, program management, pre-construction services and general construction. Hoar Construction was established in 1940 in Birmingham, Ala. The company originally specialized in community church construction and erected more than 45 church buildings during the formative years. The developing company continued to build a reputation for quality workmanship and experienced management. It expanded to commercial and industrial clients, and building office buildings, schools and retail shopping centers. Hoar Construction operates throughout much of the United States. Its average volume is more than $350 million per year.

Dunn Construction Company began as a railroad construction company in Virginia before moving to Birmingham. Operational since 1971, BSE Industrial Contractors offers a range of services for clients in the construction industry. It provides plant maintenance and rebuilding services. BSE Industrial Contractors replaces buckets, chains, rails and liners in pan conveyors. With a fleet of more than 50 cranes, the company sets concrete poles, structural towers and transformers. Its clients include United States Steel, International Paper Company, Lehigh Cement Company and Alabama Power.

It offers employee identification imaging systems and electromechanical and electronic time recorders. The company serves the educational, health care and manufacturing industries.

Founded in 1878, Dunn Construction is one of the oldest contracting businesses in the United States. The company bids and performs general contracts for the construction of industrial roads, storage yards, parking lots, subdivisions, municipal streets and airport taxiways. It also provides resurfacing and interstate and highway construction services. The company's subsidiary, Dunn Buildings, specializes in commercial, industrial and institutional construction projects. Dunn Construction's project portfolio includes Patton Creek Silt Removal, Corridor X Project Graysville, I-20 and Corridor X Highway 78. The company also provides trucking, construction material sales, portable crushing, asphalt paving, milling and site work services. Dunn Construction maintains a fleet of more than 35 dump trucks.

Harbert International, LLC has since grown to provide highway, pipeline, industrial and building construction to clients throughout the U.S. and in foreign territories. Harbert International is headquartered in Birmingham, Ala.

Founded in 1878, Dunn Construction is one of the oldest contracting businesses in the United States. Founded in 1946 and headquartered in Birmingham, Ala., Saiia Construction specializes in heavy construction, and manages customized projects. The company provides full-service site development and maintenance services for a wide range of applications, including retail and heavy industrial applications, industrial and power plants, paper mills, and mining and quarrying. It also manages projects for residential developments, office buildings and parks, municipal and industrial landfills, schools, churches, hospitals, and golf courses. Saiia Construction offers a variety of services, including site clearing and mass earthmoving, drilling and blasting, grading, storm drainage, and dam, lake, pond and dike construction. The company s civil maintenance group provides outsourcing to the pulp and paper, power generation and petrochemical industries. It provides landfill maintenance, waste hauling, and coal pile management services. Saiia Construction is affiliated with several organizations, such as Economic Development Association of Alabama, and Business Council of Alabama.

G&R Mineral Services, Inc. is a small business organization with headquarters and primary operations centralized in Birmingham, Alabama. Additional support operations are located in Cordova, Alabama, Hagerstown, Maryland and Miami, Florida with a sales office in Center Valley, Pennsylvania.  G&R is a plant maintenance and mechanical installation contractor that performs various types of erection services including crane rental, steel erection, gear installations, kiln modifications, precipitator work, plant maintenance contracts, and emergency repair service. While G&R performs contract work throughout the year, the vast majority of services performed are during annual mill and plant outages on special repair type projects when time is of the essence. G&R utilize the experience of key personnel to bid special repair projects competitively and successfully complete them on time.  G&R's primary customer base is found within the various mineral-processing industries such as cement, lime, pulp and paper, power, and steel industries.

H.N. Donahoo has complete projects for Winn-Dixie at Helena, Greystone Park, John Carroll High School, Kensington Place and Charleston Square. The company specializes in land grading and site development contracting. H.N. Donahoo started doing business in Alabama in the early 1920s and specialized in paving, sewer, water and gas pipelines. Over the years, the company has become a one-stop source for residential and commercial site development needs. The company has the capability to perform initial clearing and grading for streets, building pads, parking lots, mass excavation of dirt and rock and erosion control; installation of underground utilities, such as storm and sanitary pipes, water mains, gas lines and electrical and telephone conduits; concrete gutter construction, which includes curbs and gutters, concrete islands, sidewalks and driveways; and asphalt paving. H.N. Donahoo Contracting serves residential and commercial customers in the Birmingham, Ala., area.

Founded in 1980, PRO Construction provides restoration services for hospitals, schools, stores, restaurants, factories, libraries, laboratories, barns, private homes and garages. The company remodels commercial and private residences for architects, as well as individuals. PRO Construction offers tenant improvement, new construction, and design and build commercial services. The company restores and repairs damaged goods and contents, including books, clothing, files, documents, photographs, mementos, draperies, computers, and electronic devices and components. It also provides reconstruction and replacement services. PRO Construction offers a range of preconstruction and construction services using a systematic approach to budget development and project delivery. The company also provides stump grinding, fencing, door fitting, and pool installation and design services. It offers basement and bathroom remodeling, cabinetry installation, floor refinishing, and landscape architectural and contracting services.

Hoar Construction is a full service contractor with retail, commercial, program management and health care divisions. The company services include negotiated, bid, design-build, construction management, program management, pre-construction services and general construction. Hoar Construction was established in 1940 in Birmingham, Ala. The company originally specialized in community church construction and erected more than 45 church buildings during the formative years. The developing company continued to build a reputation for quality workmanship and experienced management. It expanded to commercial and industrial clients, and building office buildings, schools and retail shopping centers. Hoar Construction operates throughout much of the United States. Its average volume is more than $350 million per year.

Our business was founded by J. J. Cochrane in 1959 and incorporated in 1962. Mr. Cochrane had worked as General Manager for Birmingham Furnace and Roofing for many years before deciding to start his own business. With his wife as bookkeeper and her brother as sheet metal shop supervisor, he began a business that eventually spanned the Southeast. By the 1970's Cochrane Roofing was handling huge projects throughout the Southeast. We were heavily mechanized and geared towards large projects such as hospitals, colleges, manufacturing plants and shopping malls. We held general contractor's licenses in Louisiana, Florida, Tennessee, Mississippi and Kentucky in addition to our home state. After his death in 1976, J.J. Cochrane's son, W. M. Cochrane took the reins of the Company. A new direction for the Company was laid out and Cochrane Roofing began concentrating on service to Birmingham and it's surrounding areas. In the 1980's we developed a new concept in roofing in Birmingham. Originally intended to handle our own warranty work, our Service Department soon grew to become the primary marketing arm of our Company. There existed a great need for qualified professionals to handle repairs and maintenance issues for businesses and homeowners alike. Today, Cochrane Roofing has a well-earned reputation as a Tile and Slate roofing company. While we find this area of roofing to be challenging and satisfying, we also remain loyal to the systems that built this Company. Single-ply, built-up roofing, modified bitumen, and metal roofing are important facets of our work. Our ability to handle multiple roof systems makes us an ideal choice for Owners whose buildings incorporate multiple roof types.

Our business was founded by J. J. Cochrane in 1959 and incorporated in 1962. Mr. Cochrane had worked as General Manager for Birmingham Furnace and Roofing for many years before deciding to start his own business. With his wife as bookkeeper and her brother as sheet metal shop supervisor, he began a business that eventually spanned the Southeast. By the 1970's Cochrane Roofing was handling huge projects throughout the Southeast. We were heavily mechanized and geared towards large projects such as hospitals, colleges, manufacturing plants and shopping malls. We held general contractor's licenses in Louisiana, Florida, Tennessee, Mississippi and Kentucky in addition to our home state. After his death in 1976, J.J. Cochrane's son, W. M. Cochrane took the reins of the Company. A new direction for the Company was laid out and Cochrane Roofing began concentrating on service to Birmingham and it's surrounding areas. In the 1980's we developed a new concept in roofing in Birmingham. Originally intended to handle our own warranty work, our Service Department soon grew to become the primary marketing arm of our Company. There existed a great need for qualified professionals to handle repairs and maintenance issues for businesses and homeowners alike. Today, Cochrane Roofing has a well-earned reputation as a Tile and Slate roofing company. While we find this area of roofing to be challenging and satisfying, we also remain loyal to the systems that built this Company. Single-ply, built-up roofing, modified bitumen, and metal roofing are important facets of our work. Our ability to handle multiple roof systems makes us an ideal choice for Owners whose buildings incorporate multiple roof types.

Dr. Raymond Thompson, President of Vista Engineering, has been elected a Fellow of the American Society of Metals International. The award recognizes Dr. Thompson's work in material science and engineering, and was conferred at the ASM Awards Dinner on October 19, 2004 in Columbus, OH. Dr. Thompson is president of Vista Engineering, a resident company at OADI Technology Center. Vista Engineering is a materials research, development and consulting firm dedicated to the creation of innovative, cost-effective solutions for materials design and application problems. Vista 's mission is to help its clients be successful by providing research-based, practical solutions for their materials needs and problems. The company's areas of expertise include: materials research and application development in diamond coatings ; materials processing technologies including welding, casting, forging and machining ; and solutions-focused, situation-specific computer modeling of materials and their processing and application. About ASM. ASM International is the society for materials engineers and scientists, a worldwide network dedicated to advancing industry, technology, and applications of metals and materials. Our business was founded by J. J. Cochrane in 1959 and incorporated in 1962. Mr. Cochrane had worked as General Manager for Birmingham Furnace and Roofing for many years before deciding to start his own business. With his wife as bookkeeper and her brother as sheet metal shop supervisor, he began a business that eventually spanned the Southeast. By the 1970's Cochrane Roofing was handling huge projects throughout the Southeast. We were heavily mechanized and geared towards large projects such as hospitals, colleges, manufacturing plants and shopping malls. We held general contractor's licenses in Louisiana, Florida, Tennessee, Mississippi and Kentucky in addition to our home state. After his death in 1976, J.J. Cochrane's son, W. M. Cochrane took the reins of the Company. A new direction for the Company was laid out and Cochrane Roofing began concentrating on service to Birmingham and it's surrounding areas. In the 1980's we developed a new concept in roofing in Birmingham. Originally intended to handle our own warranty work, our Service Department soon grew to become the primary marketing arm of our Company. There existed a great need for qualified professionals to handle repairs and maintenance issues for businesses and homeowners alike. Today, Cochrane Roofing has a well-earned reputation as a Tile and Slate roofing company. While we find this area of roofing to be challenging and satisfying, we also remain loyal to the systems that built this Company. Single-ply, built-up roofing, modified bitumen, and metal roofing are important facets of our work. Our ability to handle multiple roof systems makes us an ideal choice for Owners whose buildings incorporate multiple roof types.

Our business was founded by J. J. Cochrane in 1959 and incorporated in 1962. Mr. Cochrane had worked as General Manager for Birmingham Furnace and Roofing for many years before deciding to start his own business. With his wife as bookkeeper and her brother as sheet metal shop supervisor, he began a business that eventually spanned the Southeast. By the 1970's Cochrane Roofing was handling huge projects throughout the Southeast. We were heavily mechanized and geared towards large projects such as hospitals, colleges, manufacturing plants and shopping malls. We held general contractor's licenses in Louisiana, Florida, Tennessee, Mississippi and Kentucky in addition to our home state. After his death in 1976, J.J. Cochrane's son, W. M. Cochrane took the reins of the Company. A new direction for the Company was laid out and Cochrane Roofing began concentrating on service to Birmingham and it's surrounding areas. In the 1980's we developed a new concept in roofing in Birmingham. Originally intended to handle our own warranty work, our Service Department soon grew to become the primary marketing arm of our Company. There existed a great need for qualified professionals to handle repairs and maintenance issues for businesses and homeowners alike. Today, Cochrane Roofing has a well-earned reputation as a Tile and Slate roofing company. While we find this area of roofing to be challenging and satisfying, we also remain loyal to the systems that built this Company. Single-ply, built-up roofing, modified bitumen, and metal roofing are important facets of our work. Our ability to handle multiple roof systems makes us an ideal choice for Owners whose buildings incorporate multiple roof types.

About ASM. ASM International is the society for materials engineers and scientists, a worldwide network dedicated to advancing industry, technology, and applications of metals and materials. In 1969, ASM established the honor of Fellow of the Society to provide recognition of members for distinguished contributions in the field of materials science and engineering and to develop a forum for technical and professional leaders to serve as advisors to the Society. Our business was founded by J. J. Cochrane in 1959 and incorporated in 1962. Mr. Cochrane had worked as General Manager for Birmingham Furnace and Roofing for many years before deciding to start his own business. With his wife as bookkeeper and her brother as sheet metal shop supervisor, he began a business that eventually spanned the Southeast. By the 1970's Cochrane Roofing was handling huge projects throughout the Southeast. We were heavily mechanized and geared towards large projects such as hospitals, colleges, manufacturing plants and shopping malls. We held general contractor's licenses in Louisiana, Florida, Tennessee, Mississippi and Kentucky in addition to our home state. After his death in 1976, J.J. Cochrane's son, W. M. Cochrane took the reins of the Company. A new direction for the Company was laid out and Cochrane Roofing began concentrating on service to Birmingham and it's surrounding areas. In the 1980's we developed a new concept in roofing in Birmingham. Originally intended to handle our own warranty work, our Service Department soon grew to become the primary marketing arm of our Company. There existed a great need for qualified professionals to handle repairs and maintenance issues for businesses and homeowners alike. Today, Cochrane Roofing has a well-earned reputation as a Tile and Slate roofing company. While we find this area of roofing to be challenging and satisfying, we also remain loyal to the systems that built this Company. Single-ply, built-up roofing, modified bitumen, and metal roofing are important facets of our work. Our ability to handle multiple roof systems makes us an ideal choice for Owners whose buildings incorporate multiple roof types.

Dr. Raymond Thompson, President of Vista Engineering, has been elected a Fellow of the American Society of Metals International. Vista Engineering is a materials research, development and consulting firm dedicated to the creation of innovative, cost-effective solutions for materials design and application problems. About ASM. ASM International is the society for materials engineers and scientists, a worldwide network dedicated to advancing industry, technology, and applications of metals and materials. In 1969, ASM established the honor of Fellow of the Society to provide recognition of members for distinguished contributions in the field of materials science and engineering and to develop a forum for technical and professional leaders to serve as advisors to the Society. The Fellows provide guidance to the Board of Trustees to enhance the capability of ASM as a technical and professional society to serve the technical community in the field of materials science and engineering in the years ahead. 1500 1st Ave. N., AL 35203 Birmingham Unit 14 Birmingham Phone 205.307.6550 Fax 205.307.6551 Copyright 2009 Vista Engineering

Our business was founded by J. J. Cochrane in 1959 and incorporated in 1962. Mr. Cochrane had worked as General Manager for Birmingham Furnace and Roofing for many years before deciding to start his own business. With his wife as bookkeeper and her brother as sheet metal shop supervisor, he began a business that eventually spanned the Southeast. By the 1970's Cochrane Roofing was handling huge projects throughout the Southeast. We were heavily mechanized and geared towards large projects such as hospitals, colleges, manufacturing plants and shopping malls. We held general contractor's licenses in Louisiana, Florida, Tennessee, Mississippi and Kentucky in addition to our home state. After his death in 1976, J.J. Cochrane's son, W. M. Cochrane took the reins of the Company. A new direction for the Company was laid out and Cochrane Roofing began concentrating on service to Birmingham and it's surrounding areas. In the 1980's we developed a new concept in roofing in Birmingham. Originally intended to handle our own warranty work, our Service Department soon grew to become the primary marketing arm of our Company. Our business was founded by J. J. Cochrane in 1959 and incorporated in 1962. Mr. Cochrane had worked as General Manager for Birmingham Furnace and Roofing for many years before deciding to start his own business. With his wife as bookkeeper and her brother as sheet metal shop supervisor, he began a business that eventually spanned the Southeast. By the 1970's Cochrane Roofing was handling huge projects throughout the Southeast. We were heavily mechanized and geared towards large projects such as hospitals, colleges, manufacturing plants and shopping malls. We held general contractor's licenses in Louisiana, Florida, Tennessee, Mississippi and Kentucky in addition to our home state. After his death in 1976, J.J. Cochrane's son, W. M. Cochrane took the reins of the Company. A new direction for the Company was laid out and Cochrane Roofing began concentrating on service to Birmingham and it's surrounding areas. In the 1980's we developed a new concept in roofing in Birmingham. Originally intended to handle our own warranty work, our Service Department soon grew to become the primary marketing arm of our Company. There existed a great need for qualified professionals to handle repairs and maintenance issues for businesses and homeowners alike. Today, Cochrane Roofing has a well-earned reputation as a Tile and Slate roofing company. While we find this area of roofing to be challenging and satisfying, we also remain loyal to the systems that built this Company. Single-ply, built-up roofing, modified bitumen, and metal roofing are important facets of our work. Our ability to handle multiple roof systems makes us an ideal choice for Owners whose buildings incorporate multiple roof types.

About ASM. ASM International is the society for materials engineers and scientists, a worldwide network dedicated to advancing industry, technology, and applications of metals and materials. In 1969, ASM established the honor of Fellow of the Society to provide recognition of members for distinguished contributions in the field of materials science and engineering and to develop a forum for technical and professional leaders to serve as advisors to the Society. The Fellows provide guidance to the Board of Trustees to enhance the capability of ASM as a technical and professional society to serve the technical community in the field of materials science and engineering in the years ahead. 1500 1st Ave. N., AL 35203 Birmingham Unit 14 Birmingham Phone 205.307.6550 Fax 205.307.6551 Copyright 2009 Vista Engineering

Our business was founded by J. J. Cochrane in 1959 and incorporated in 1962. Mr. Cochrane had worked as General Manager for Birmingham Furnace and Roofing for many years before deciding to start his own business. With his wife as bookkeeper and her brother as sheet metal shop supervisor, he began a business that eventually spanned the Southeast. By the 1970's Cochrane Roofing was handling huge projects throughout the Southeast. We were heavily mechanized and geared towards large projects such as hospitals, colleges, manufacturing plants and shopping malls. We held general contractor's licenses in Louisiana, Florida, Tennessee, Mississippi and Kentucky in addition to our home state. After his death in 1976, J.J. Cochrane's son, W. M. Cochrane took the reins of the Company. A new direction for the Company was laid out and Cochrane Roofing began concentrating on service to Birmingham and it's surrounding areas. In the 1980's we developed a new concept in roofing in Birmingham. Originally intended to handle our own warranty work, our Service Department soon grew to become the primary marketing arm of our Company. There existed a great need for qualified professionals to handle repairs and maintenance issues for businesses and homeowners alike. Today, Cochrane Roofing has a well-earned reputation as a Tile and Slate roofing company. While we find this area of roofing to be challenging and satisfying, we also remain loyal to the systems that built this Company. Single-ply, built-up roofing, modified bitumen, and metal roofing are important facets of our work. Our ability to handle multiple roof systems makes us an ideal choice for Owners whose buildings incorporate multiple roof types.

Our business was founded by J. J. Cochrane in 1959 and incorporated in 1962. Mr. Cochrane had worked as General Manager for Birmingham Furnace and Roofing for many years before deciding to start his own business. With his wife as bookkeeper and her brother as sheet metal shop supervisor, he began a business that eventually spanned the Southeast. By the 1970's Cochrane Roofing was handling huge projects throughout the Southeast. We were heavily mechanized and geared towards large projects such as hospitals, colleges, manufacturing plants and shopping malls. We held general contractor's licenses in Louisiana, Florida, Tennessee, Mississippi and Kentucky in addition to our home state. After his death in 1976, J.J. Cochrane's son, W. M. Cochrane took the reins of the Company. A new direction for the Company was laid out and Cochrane Roofing began concentrating on service to Birmingham and it's surrounding areas. In the 1980's we developed a new concept in roofing in Birmingham. Originally intended to handle our own warranty work, our Service Department soon grew to become the primary marketing arm of our Company. There existed a great need for qualified professionals to handle repairs and maintenance issues for businesses and homeowners alike. Today, Cochrane Roofing has a well-earned reputation as a Tile and Slate roofing company. While we find this area of roofing to be challenging and satisfying, we also remain loyal to the systems that built this Company. Single-ply, built-up roofing, modified bitumen, and metal roofing are important facets of our work. Our ability to handle multiple roof systems makes us an ideal choice for Owners whose buildings incorporate multiple roof types.

In 1969, ASM established the honor of Fellow of the Society to provide recognition of members for distinguished contributions in the field of materials science and engineering and to develop a forum for technical and professional leaders to serve as advisors to the Society. Our business was founded by J. J. Cochrane in 1959 and incorporated in 1962. Mr. Cochrane had worked as General Manager for Birmingham Furnace and Roofing for many years before deciding to start his own business. With his wife as bookkeeper and her brother as sheet metal shop supervisor, he began a business that eventually spanned the Southeast. By the 1970's Cochrane Roofing was handling huge projects throughout the Southeast. We were heavily mechanized and geared towards large projects such as hospitals, colleges, manufacturing plants and shopping malls. We held general contractor's licenses in Louisiana, Florida, Tennessee, Mississippi and Kentucky in addition to our home state. After his death in 1976, J.J. Cochrane's son, W. M. Cochrane took the reins of the Company. A new direction for the Company was laid out and Cochrane Roofing began concentrating on service to Birmingham and it's surrounding areas. In the 1980's we developed a new concept in roofing in Birmingham. Originally intended to handle our own warranty work, our Service Department soon grew to become the primary marketing arm of our Company. There existed a great need for qualified professionals to handle repairs and maintenance issues for businesses and homeowners alike. Today, Cochrane Roofing has a well-earned reputation as a Tile and Slate roofing company. While we find this area of roofing to be challenging and satisfying, we also remain loyal to the systems that built this Company. Single-ply, built-up roofing, modified bitumen, and metal roofing are important facets of our work. Our ability to handle multiple roof systems makes us an ideal choice for Owners whose buildings incorporate multiple roof types.

Our business was founded by J. J. Cochrane in 1959 and incorporated in 1962. Mr. Cochrane had worked as General Manager for Birmingham Furnace and Roofing for many years before deciding to start his own business. With his wife as bookkeeper and her brother as sheet metal shop supervisor, he began a business that eventually spanned the Southeast. By the 1970's Cochrane Roofing was handling huge projects throughout the Southeast. We were heavily mechanized and geared towards large projects such as hospitals, colleges, manufacturing plants and shopping malls. We held general contractor's licenses in Louisiana, Florida, Tennessee, Mississippi and Kentucky in addition to our home state. After his death in 1976, J.J. Cochrane's son, W. M. Cochrane took the reins of the Company. A new direction for the Company was laid out and Cochrane Roofing began concentrating on service to Birmingham and it's surrounding areas. In the 1980's we developed a new concept in roofing in Birmingham. Originally intended to handle our own warranty work, our Service Department soon grew to become the primary marketing arm of our Company. There existed a great need for qualified professionals to handle repairs and maintenance issues for businesses and homeowners alike. Today, Cochrane Roofing has a well-earned reputation as a Tile and Slate roofing company. While we find this area of roofing to be challenging and satisfying, we also remain loyal to the systems that built this Company. Single-ply, built-up roofing, modified bitumen, and metal roofing are important facets of our work. Our ability to handle multiple roof systems makes us an ideal choice for Owners whose buildings incorporate multiple roof types.

Dr. Raymond Thompson, President of Vista Engineering, has been elected a Fellow of the American Society of Metals International. Vista Engineering is a materials research, development and consulting firm dedicated to the creation of innovative, cost-effective solutions for materials design and application problems. About ASM. ASM International is the society for materials engineers and scientists, a worldwide network dedicated to advancing industry, technology, and applications of metals and materials. In 1969, ASM established the honor of Fellow of the Society to provide recognition of members for distinguished contributions in the field of materials science and engineering and to develop a forum for technical and professional leaders to serve as advisors to the Society. The Fellows provide guidance to the Board of Trustees to enhance the capability of ASM as a technical and professional society to serve the technical community in the field of materials science and engineering in the years ahead. 1500 1st Ave. N., AL 35203 Birmingham Unit 14 Birmingham Phone 205.307.6550 Fax 205.307.6551 Copyright 2009 Vista Engineering

Operational for more than 40 years, Brasfield & Gorrie is a full-service general contractor and a Forbes 500 company that serves the Southeast. It operates offices in Alabama, Tennessee, Florida and North Carolina. N.C. Brasfield & Gorrie provides construction services for various types of building projects, including health care, industrial, multistory office, institutional, condominium, hotel, retail, parking and water treatment facilities. The company has completed projects in more than 10 U.S. states. It has over 10 operating divisions and nearly 2,600 employees. Brasfield & Gorrie offers construction management services on negotiated contracts and bids during the design phase. Its projects include Caterpillar Financial Center, AmSouth Operations Center and Georgia Baptist Convention.

Founded in 1955, Mike Mitchell Homes is a homebuilding company that has constructed communities, such as Grants Mill, Woodruff Farms, Saddle Pointe, Creels Crossing, Trapper s Ridge, Brooke Trace, Somerset North, Franklin Parc and Silver Lakes. It has also constructed Hearthstone, Westchester, Forest Ridge, Eason Ville and Greenbriar. The company s properties feature masons, heating and air conditioning equipment, vinyl windows, sheet metal ducts, cabinets and light fixtures. Mike Mitchell Homes provides various flooring options and loan calculators. The company is a member of the National Association of Home Builders and the Greater Birmingham Association for Home Builders. Its properties feature fireplace areas and appliances from GE.

Located in Birmingham, Ala., Prier construction Inc. provides general contracting services to its clients. The company specializes in handling construction projects for the health care, industrial, office and retail sectors. The company is a recipient of the Associated Builders and Contractors Award. Prier construction Inc. is certified by the Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) and serves residential buildings, medical and commercial industries. It has worked on various projects, such as Cahaba Fitness, Cambridge Coffee, and Diamond's Direct in Cahaba Village, Hawthorne Art Gallery/Loft and Highway 11 Retail Center.

Founded in 1990, Bradford Building Company provides a range of construction services and products. It specializes in several areas of construction, including retail shops, financial institutions, offices, warehouses, restaurants and custom residences. Its clients include McAlister's Gourmet Deli, Golfsmith International, Sumo Japanese Steak House and Shoemaker Pools. The company s business partners include banks, insurance companies and certified public accountants. It commercial division employs various project and field operations managers. Its accounting division employs in-house financial officers, human resource and accounting managers. Bradford Building Company offers construction services throughout the state of Alabama and its office is located in Birmingham, Ala.
